thread.title: Police investigating vandalism, racist graffiti at Tahoe Park businesses
thread.title_full: Police investigating vandalism, racist graffiti at Tahoe Park businesses

author: Sacramento Bee staff
title: Police investigating vandalism, racist graffiti at Tahoe Park businesses
text:
February 1, 2017 7:57 AM Police investigating vandalism, racist graffiti at Tahoe Park businesses 
Covering crime, police and courts in the Sacramento region A Google Earth image shows the strip mall where the businesses are located. Google Earth video image i 
Sacramento Bee staff 
Sacramento police are investigating vandalism at a barbershop and meat market in the Tahoe Park neighborhood, off Broadway. 
MoMo’s Meat Market, located at 58th and Broadway, was broken into and then the burglars made their way into a neighboring barbershop. Windows were smashed and other property was damaged. 
Inside the barbershop vandals spray painted a swastika and the “N” word. Fox40 news reported that the incident is being investigated as a hate crime. 
In a Facebook post , one customer, Isaac Gonzalez, shared photos of the cleanup and said he talked to the meat shop’s owner, who told him he’s not letting the crime get him down. 
Police have not released any suspect information.
